736000170: Blessed we, at your side, on this journey.
736000180: Serve you we shall, in life, eternal.
740500100: <battlefield warcry - rallying his own spirit by shouting the name of his home: "For Kaiden!" etc.>
743000110: Feral flame of Agheel, burn true...
743000210: We journey on a road so far,
743000230: Coffin in tow, we'll find a hero
743000240: And scraps of his great deeds!
743000260: Who rode along this road before?
743000310: <Pathetic nonverbal wail that seems to suggest "Stop! Just go away!">
743000320: <Pathetic nonverbal wail when he suddenly notices a stranger nearby>
743000410: Grant us the droplets of life,
743000440: We swat at flies, snuff out flame,
743000450: Repel the Omen, and undo Tarnish.
743000460: Blessed we, at your side, eternal.
743000470: Blessed we, at your side, on this journey.
743000480: Serve you we shall, in life, eternal.
743400100: <Incoherent rambling. Very quiet, but sounds acutely irritated and on the verge of breaking out in madness.>
743400110: <The wings of a fly reverberate inside his headpiece, and it becomes too much to tolerate - he makes this sound as his psyche snaps.>
743820100: <Sound of swinging a giant pickaxe. A slow swing with much weight. Several versions.>
743820110: <A shout as he holds his pickaxe high, mustering strength. Several versions.>
746000100: <A roar as he releases the all the strength that he was holding inside. A growly warcry.>
746000110: <He screams to intimidate his foe as he draws his sword.>
746000120: <A shout as he holds his sword high, mustering strength: whoaahhh! Etc.>
746000130: <Feeling bored and exhausted, his jaw drops open and this sound emanates from deep down his throat. It is a low bellowing that can be heard echoing around the vicinity.>
746900200: <Invigorating shouts for repeated rapier thrusts. Sharply enunciated, suggesting proper training.>
800001000: You're a Tarnished, I can see it.
800001020: That you're not after my throat.
800001030: Then why not purchase a little something?
800001040: I am Kalé. Purveyor of fine goods.
800002000: What is it? Still going to purchase something?
800003010: Well, you're back. Care to buy something?
800004010: Always a pleasure. Care to purchase anything?
800007000: I am of a nomadic people.
800007020: The land has been tainted by madness since the shattering of the Elden Ring.
800007030: It's only Tarnished like yourself who keep things from drying up entirely.
800007040: Let's say you're a very welcome customer.
800008000: You know, if you can spare the runes,
800008010: you should buy yourself a crafting kit.
800008020: A crafting kit allows you to make basic items on your own.
800008030: Essential really, if you intend to survive out here for any duration.
800008040: The kit costs a bundle, and I admit, I do take my cut.
800008050: But the important thing is that you survive. Every customer counts, after all.
800009000: I'm glad you took my warning to heart.
800010000: There are others of my people who yet survive in these lands.
800010010: If the mood takes you when you meet one, then offer them some trade, won't you?
800010020: My people, wanderers all, have long been spurned by the grace of gold.
800010030: Which is why we cannot settle, but instead are forced into this pitiful, unceasing journey.
800010040: But thanks to that, things are not so different for us now, though the Elden Ring is shattered.
800010050: I think this makes us kindred spirits of sorts.
800010060: Your people, the Tarnished, and mine.
800011000: I suppose I shouldn't keep this from you.
800011010: I'm thinking of moving elsewhere for a time.
800011020: My people are wanderers all, which I won't deny is one reason...
800011030: But I've done all I can here, in search of the Great Caravan.
800012000: Perhaps you don't need to hear this, but...
800012010: See that no harm comes to my kin.
800012020: We have a saying, we wanderers.
800012030: Lament not your solitude. Expect no sympathy. No regard. Nothing.
800012040: But if anyone dares harm us, show them no mercy.
800012050: That is our code, so to speak.
800012060: Just the way we are. Deeply... unforgiving.
800013010: Have you heard of the Great Caravan?
800014010: Well, even we had a place to call home, once.\n
800014020: The Great Caravan, they called it… but it's been lost to us for ages.
800014030: I've been searching for it as long as I can remember.
800014040: And with a name like that,
800014050: You'd hope they kept some fine goods there, eh.
800015000: The howl of a wolf, in the Mistwood...
800015010: I suppose he must still be skulking about...
800015020: Mmm, I know. Why not meet him for yourself?
800015030: Next time you hear the wolf's howl, make this signal right under the source.
800015040: Oh, don't fret, there is nothing to fear.
800015050: I just have an inkling the two of you might hit it off.
800016000: Oh, by the way. There's someone you should meet.
800016010: If you happen to hear a wolf's howl, make this signal under the source.
800017000: Oh, then you met Blaidd, did you?
800017010: Wonderful. I'm glad I pointed you in his direction.
800017020: He's boorish, blunt, and couldn't find his nose with both hands, but he's a good egg.
800017030: I think the two of you are sure to find the best in one another.
800030010: I knew leaving the sign would be worth the trouble.
800030020: Thought I'd set up shop here for a time.
800030030: A pleasure, as ever. Care to purchase anything?
800031020: Thought I'd set up shop here for a time.
800031030: Right then. Care to purchase anything?
800032000: Have you seen a crow around here by any chance?
800032010: You know, a burial crow, with a letter fastened to its claw?
800032020: Well, if you do set eyes upon it, I'll buy that letter from you, no question.
800032030: I'd give you a generous sum for it, of course.
800033000: My thanks. I've been wanting to get my hands on this.
800033010: And I was willing to pay whatever was needed. Your reward, as promised.
800034000: So, about the letter you brought me...
800034010: It's just as I suspected, it features a cryptogram of my people.
800034020: And I'm sure it's come from wherever the Great Caravan disappeared to.
800034030: This could be my chance to get close to it.
800035000: Once I decipher that cryptogram, I'll be packing up shop again.
800035010: Don't worry, I'll leave a sign that shows where I've gone.
800035020: With any luck, I'll see you there, eh.
800036000: I've always preferred my own company, to that of other people's...
800036010: And I don't have any burning questions I wish to ask my ancestors...
800036020: But there's something I need to know.
800036040: I want to know who I am. Where I came from. Where I'm headed.
800050010: I knew leaving the sign would be worth the trouble.
800050020: The shop is all set up.
800050030: A pleasure as ever. Care to purchase anything?
800051000: Oh yes, about the cryptogram from the letter...
800051010: I think it's pointing underneath the capital.
800051020: I think it's pointing here, underneath the capital.
800051030: But I'm perplexed as to the path to take down there.
800051040: Well, the journey can wait, I suppose.
800051050: I'll settle here for the time being, and start looking into it.
800053000: I can't imagine how it ended up there...
800053010: But the well might just lead under the capital.
800053020: To the spot indicated by the cryptogram from the letter.
800053030: Seems like an odd place for the Great Caravan...
800053040: But no amount of thinking will change anything. I'll be heading straight there, after some preparation.
800053050: Once again, I find myself in your debt.
800053060: Take this, as a token of my appreciation.
800053070: It's not from my usual stock, but something rather more special.
800053080: I hope you can join me at the Great Caravan, in fact.
800053090: Who knows what wonders there might be to trade?
800054010: Did you see? What they did to my ancestors?
800054020: The whole clan, buried alive. Sick. Maddened. Husks of themselves.
800054030: Have you heard their moans? They're hardly human anymore.
800054040: They think we worship the Three Fingers? That we called the maddening sickness down upon them?
800054050: Well. If that's what they expect from us, then that's what they shall get from us!
800054060: The world of grace and its people should have been content to see us sink between the cracks.
800054070: But to have intruded upon our solace... Having broken us upon their whims...
800054080: I'll never forgive any of you.
800055000: I'm sorry, but we won't be trading any longer.
800055010: And...I think it's time we parted ways.
800055020: Guided by grace, you seek to become Elden Lord.
800055030: I don't want anything to do with you Tarnished lot any more.
800056010: It's my fault that we stumbled into this mess.
800057000: I'm sorry, but we won't be trading any longer.
800057010: I think it's time we parted ways.
800058030: You've inherited the flame of frenzy!
800058040: Oh, that's it... That's what I need...
800058050: To melt away the curses, suffering, and despair. And the Order, entire.
800059000: Oh, that's it... That's what I need...
800059010: To melt away the curses, suffering, and despair. And the Order, entire.
800070000: O Three Fingers, throw wide the door.
800070010: Please, bestow unto me the yellow flame of chaos.
800070020: A frenzied flame to melt away the curses, suffering, and despair. And the Order, entire.
800071010: I was not... a suitable home.
800071030: You, who reached the Three Fingers' abyss...
800071040: Tell the one... Who will become Lord...
800071050: Divest yourself of everything, and head to the door.
800071080: To melt away the curses, suffering, and despair. And the Order, entire.
800072010: I was not... a suitable home.
800072030: Melt away the curses, suffering, and despair. And the Order, entire.
800100000: Are you offering that drink to me?
800100010: Oh, no, what do you take me for? I am an honest merchant of good standing!
800100030: Oh, for heaven's sake, I jest.
800100040: That's a very kind gesture, and I accept.
800100050: A pleasure as ever, old friend.
800802000: I knew you for a highwayman all along.
800802010: Then it's time you learnt a lesson.
800802020: Our people will not stand for your barbarism!
800803000: Is that all you were, mate?
800811000: So you're just like the others?
800811010: Another would-be oppressor to my people.
800812000: I see. I see how it is! You were one of them all along!
800812010: Trying to trample us underfoot, you grace-given bastard?
800814000: Your kind...will all be razed clean.
801001010: Yes, right this way... Right this way...
801002010: Valued customer... Come trade, in our wandering emporium.
801002030: I'm hungry. I've been hungry so long. Please.
801003010: How nice of you to stop by, again.
801050010: Surprised you found me in my little nook.
801050020: No matter, no matter. Your money's as good as anyone else's.
801050030: Why don't you take a look at my wares?
801050050: Don't ask me how I got my hands on them, eh.
801051010: Not everyone can tell how good my wares are. You've a discerning eye, you have.
801200020: Are you here as a customer?
801202020: I-I didn't realise you came back.
801203010: I'm afraid I've very little to offer.
801204000: Oh, nothing that suits your tastes, then?
801252010: Well, be on your way, then.
801300010: It's been an age since I've seen a customer.
801300020: How can I help, here at the end of the earth?
801302020: Did this aged merchant have something that caught your eye?
801350020: Well, how long has it been.
801352010: Divorce from one's trade does not come easily.
801801000: Bollocks! What the devil's wrong with you!
801803010: Melt away with the rest of it...
801810010: What are you playing at! Stop this!
801811000: That's the last straw, you bloody thief!
801812000: Stay away, Us wanderers have had enough.
801840030: It was me! It's all my fault!
801842000: I warned you. I told you to stop...
801851000: I knew it, you dirty scoundrel!
801851010: There was something off about you from the start!
801852000: Hurry up and die! You wretched thief!
801863010: Of the swiftness of a wanderer's fury.
801872000: You'd come this far for your pillaging?
801872010: No different than a plague, your kind.
801873000: I've heard enough from you. Be gone.
801874000: All that I wanted was solitude…

1201100010: That Marika, and the fingers that guided her, were unsound from the start.
1201100020: Well, the truth lies deeper still.
1201100030: It is their mother who is damaged and unhinged.
1201100040: The fingers are but unripe children. Victims in their own right.
1201100050: We all need a mother, do we not?
1201100060: A new mother, a true mother, who will not give birth to further malady.
1201200010: I failed you. Failed to birth you whole.
1201200020: But it won't be long now.
1201200030: I will soon be a mother. I will give you new life.
1201200040: I assure you, you will have life.
1201210000: Please, will you allow the two of us this time alone?
1201300030: I will be the true mother.
1201300040: And I will be the only mother!
1201450000: I will be the true mother!
1201500010: Truly, I desired...to be your mother...
1209000100: <medium and long exertions for birthing fingers from stomach>
1209000200: <taking damage from different types of attacks>
1209000300: <takes a final lethal blow, and exhales a final breath>
1500100010: O Bayle, tyrant drake, do your wounds yet ache?
1500100020: Is your fury still yet to crest its zenith?
1500100030: Hurry, hurry, and lay it all to waste!
1500100040: Lay waste to the proud, the conceited, each,\nev'ry last one of that arrogant lot.
1500101010: Oh, how it hurts...from very tip to toe...
1500101030: Help me, I must ask... Am I human still?
1500101040: Is that the reason...I yet suffer so?
1500103020: Put to the torch...by Messmer...and his lot.
1500103030: What did we do to deserve such a fate?
1500103040: We merely lived our lives... We lived in peace...
1500106010: Ah-hah, my theory is proven true!
1500106020: The finger creepers hail from these ruins.
1500106030: So now must I sound this one hanging bell,
1500106040: and sweetly cradled shall I come to be,
1500106050: at the bosom...of the exalted mother.
1500117030: The raw stuff from which I shall surely forge
1500117040: a curse. Upon the dastard Messmer's head.\nUpon Marika's children each and all.
1500120010: I was once told a coffin could convey...\nIts passenger upon a gentle cruise...
1500120020: To the velvet garden of deepest purple.
1500120030: Oh...to slumber in such a paradise...
1500122040: How long must this holy war stretch on?
1500123010: By Grace, if e'er I see another rock...
1500123020: I shall find it, of this I have no doubt.
1500123030: The altar of the forge cannot be far...
1500200010: For pity's sake, your place is in the jar.
1500200030: For shamans like you, this is your lot.
1500200040: Life were you accorded for this alone.
1500208010: Stop... Avert your gaze from me!
1500217010: No, such a thing is utterly inconceivable...
1500217030: Messmer is the son of Queen Marika...
1500217040: Her Grace would never abandon her own flesh and blood...
1500400010: O please, grant me the courage...
1500400020: To fly to your feet, my dearest...
1500402030: Something you should not have. Under any circumstances.
1500402040: How will you salvation offer...to those who cannot be saved?
1500402050: When you could not even save your other self?
1500501010: O tower of ours, hidden in shadow. O lofty spiral piercing the heavens.
1500501020: Lead him safely unto greater Godhood.
1500501030: And in divinity grant our salvation.
1500705010: I welcome you, O uninvited guest.
1500705020: But must I warn, as you venture in... Heed the words of our great master, Midra.
1500706010: I beg you stop. Haven't I taken enough?
1500706020: Are we not brethren, common in our line?
1500706030: And yet, you offer only cruelty...
1500706040: I ask; what crime did great Midra commit?
1500801010: Oh please. Not the jar... Anything but that!
1500801020: I promise. I won't ever do it again!
1500801030: I swear—a living saint I'll surely be!
1500801040: Please...you must forgive me. Forgive me, please.
1500803010: Please, I can't stand the sound...
